About

About TeAro.org

Why Car-Free Cities Matter

Cities around the world are recognizing that being designed around cars rather than people has created numerous problems:

Climate Impact

Transportation is one of the largest sources of greenhouse gas emissions. In Wellington, road transport accounts for over 34% of our emissions. Creating car-free zones is one of the most effective ways to reduce our climate impact while making the city more resilient to climate change.

Public Health

Car-dominated cities contribute to:

  • Poor air quality and respiratory issues
  • Reduced physical activity and obesity
  • Traffic accidents and deaths
  • Noise pollution and stress
  • Social isolation and mental health impacts

Social Equity

Car-centric planning creates inequity:

  • Cars and parking take up valuable public space that could be used for housing, parks, or community facilities
  • Car ownership is expensive and excludes many people from fully participating in city life
  • Children, elderly, and disabled people often can't drive but still need to navigate the city
  • Low-income neighborhoods often bear the worst impacts of traffic and pollution

Economic Benefits

Car-free areas consistently show economic advantages:

  • Increased foot traffic for local businesses
  • Higher property values
  • Reduced infrastructure maintenance costs
  • More efficient use of valuable urban land
  • Greater attraction for tourists and visitors

Why Te Aro?

Te Aro is perfectly positioned to become a car-free district:

  • Compact, walkable layout
  • High density of residents and businesses
  • Excellent public transport connections
  • Strong existing pedestrian culture
  • Success of Cuba Street as a car-free zone

Our Vision

TeAro.org advocates for expanding Wellington's car-free vision beyond the Golden Mile transformation. While the Golden Mile project is an exciting first step in prioritizing people over cars, we believe Te Aro can become a model for sustainable urban living in Aotearoa New Zealand.

This website is a project of Evan Henshaw-Plath, a web developer and activist who envisions a more equitable and sustainable Wellington. Based in Mt Victoria, P≈çneke, he sees the potential for Te Aro to join the global movement of cities reclaiming their streets for people.

What We Advocate For

Our key proposals include:

  • Extending car-free zones beyond the Golden Mile
  • Removing on-street parking except for mobility permit holders and essential deliveries
  • Creating a network of living streets and pedestrian zones
  • Prioritizing public transport and active mobility
  • Adding more trees, seating, and public spaces
  • Implementing low-traffic neighborhoods
  • Supporting bike and scooter share systems
  • Improving accessibility for all users

Growing Support

2,500+ Petition Signatures
15+ Local Business Partners
30+ Community Events

Join the Movement

Cities worldwide are proving that car-free centers work. From Oslo to Paris, Barcelona to Copenhagen, the evidence is clear: when we prioritize people over cars, everyone benefits. Wellington can join these forward-thinking cities in creating a more livable, sustainable, and vibrant urban environment.

We invite you to learn more through our articles, share your ideas, and join the conversation about making Te Aro a better place for everyone.
